home.heroTitle: Learn how to use Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT) in a compassionate, effective, and tailored way with neurodivergent individuals.
home.heroDescription: ACT applied to neurodiversity. Discover practical tools within an ACT framework that respects neurocognitive differences.
home.quote: Embrace your demons and follow your heart
home.montrealSuccess: Thank you! You will be notified when Montreal details are available.
home.montrealError: Something went wrong. Please try again later.
home.emailNotifyText: Enter your email address to not miss out.
home.citiesPageSubtitle: Choose the city and date that work for you to take part in the ACT masterclass with Dr. Russ Harris.
home.aboutDescription1: Dr. Russ Harris is a physician, psychotherapist, and one of the world's most respected ACT trainers. The author of the international bestseller The Happiness Trap, translated into over 30 languages, he has trained more than 90,000 mental health professionals worldwide.
home.aboutDescription2: His unique approach combines scientific rigour with practical accessibility, making complex ACT concepts immediately applicable in clinical settings.
home.hexaflexDescription: The Hexaflex model presents six interconnected processes that form the core clinical levers of ACT. Together, they promote psychological flexibility: the ability to make space for difficult experiences while committing to actions guided by personal values.
home.process1Description: Being fully aware of and engaged in the here and now, rather than being caught up in thoughts about the past or the future.
home.process2Description: Opening up to difficult thoughts and emotions without struggling with them, thereby freeing up energy for effective action.
home.process3Description: Observing thoughts as mental events rather than absolute truths, thereby reducing their influence.
home.process4Description: Developing a transcendent perspective, the "observing self," that can hold and make space for all experiences.
home.process5Description: Clarifying what truly matters in life and using those values as a compass to guide action.
home.process6Description: Taking action in line with one's values, even in the presence of difficult thoughts and emotions.
home.professionalsDescription: This training is designed for therapists, psychologists, physicians, counsellors, and coaches who wish to enhance their practice with ACT.
home.professional1Description: Integrate ACT into your practice to help clients develop psychological flexibility.
home.professional2Description: Learn practical tools to support patients in coping with chronic pain and illness.
home.professional3Description: Enrich your toolkit with values-based and committed action interventions.
home.professional4Description: Help clients overcome internal obstacles and live in alignment with their core values.
home.testimonial1: Russ Harris is an exceptional trainer who makes ACT accessible and applicable. His workshops transform clinical practice.
home.testimonial2: Russ's ability to teach ACT with clarity and compassion is remarkable. This is a training not to be missed.
home.ctaDescription: Register now to secure your spot.

masterclass.title: The Program
masterclass.description1: This intensive two-day masterclass will immerse you in the core of Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT) as applied to neurodiversity. You will explore the theoretical foundations, practical techniques, and clinical applications of this innovative therapeutic approach.
masterclass.description2: Autism and ADHD are neurotypes that come with many strengths, but also with problems. The good news is, with its flexible format, and easy-to-adapt core processes, ACT is ideally suited for making a difference – especially when delivered from a neurodiversity-affirming stance.
masterclass.description3: In this advanced-level workshop, you'll learn how to use ACT effectively with common neurodivergent issues – including how to scaffold executive functioning, build positive self-identity, break through task inertia, recover from burnout, and do quick, simple 'mindfulness on the go' practices (great for those who can't 'sit still & focus').
masterclass.day1Morning: Introduction to ACT: history and philosophy • The hexaflex model: the 6 fundamental processes • Practical demonstrations and exercises
masterclass.day1Afternoon: Psychological acceptance and cognitive defusion • Contact with the present moment • Practical exercises and case studies
masterclass.day2Morning: Self as context and values • Commitment to action • Integration of ACT processes into practice
masterclass.day2Afternoon: Specific applications: anxiety, depression, chronic pain • Common challenges and pitfalls to avoid • Q&A and clinical cases
masterclass.objective1: Understand the theoretical and philosophical foundations of ACT
masterclass.objective2: Master the six core processes of the Hexaflex model
masterclass.objective3: Learn practical techniques that can be applied immediately
masterclass.objective4: Develop skills to integrate ACT into your practice
masterclass.objective5: Manage common challenges and avoid therapeutic pitfalls
masterclass.resource1: Articles & research on ACT with Autism and ADHD
masterclass.resource5: Professionally recorded audios of key exercises
masterclass.ctaDescription: Reserve your seat now for this exceptional masterclass.
masterclass.programIntro1: At least 10% of the population meets criteria for ADHD, Autism, or both. (Russ himself is an ADHDer.) And often there's co-occurence with trauma, depression, anxiety disorders, or addiction. This two-day in person workshop will teach you how to modify, adapt and apply ACT flexibly and effectively with the full range of clinical issues commonly found in neurodivergent populations. (The focus is on adults, but everything is relevant and easily adaptable to adolescents.)
masterclass.programGoodNews1: The good news: thanks to social justice movements all around the globe, stigma, prejudice, and discrimination against neurodivergent people is falling.
masterclass.programBadNews: The bad news: many neurodivergent (ND) folk struggle greatly, as they grapple with the difficulties of life in a neurotypical world. Often, they have a long and painful history of trauma and rejection, and repeated subjection to prejudice, discrimination, or bullying. Hardly surprising then that mental health issues are pervasive in ND populations, and dual or triple diagnoses are common.
masterclass.programGoodNews2: Back to the good news: with its flexible format, and easy-to-adapt core processes, ACT is ideally suited for making a difference. This advanced-level workshop will teach you how to effectively use ACT, in a neurodiversity-affirming format, with common ND issues.
masterclass.whatsInvolvedIntro: We'll kick off a quick look at neurobiology, neurodivergent culture, and neurodiversity-affirming therapy. Then through role plays, videos of therapy sessions, live demonstrations, and many experiential exercises, you'll develop practical skills to:
masterclass.whatsInvolved1: Understand ND issues through a biopsychosocial lens
masterclass.whatsInvolved3: Adapt your communication style to better suit your clients
masterclass.whatsInvolved4: Accommodate sensory and other needs of your clients
masterclass.whatsInvolved5: Help clients harness their strengths to enable effective action, foster self-acceptance, and build a positive self-identity
masterclass.whatsInvolved6: Do neuroaffirmative 'bodywork' to help clients develop somatosensory awareness, and build emotional literacy
masterclass.whatsInvolved11: Create all sorts of quick'n'easy attention-improving practices ideal for clients who 'hate mindfulness', can't sit still, or find meditation impossible
masterclass.whatsInvolved12: Create and use flexible, compassionate therapeutic interventions that are applicable across the broadest possible range of neurodivergent issues: from distractibility, impulsivity and hyperfocus to sensory overload, burnout and masking
masterclass.whatsInvolvedImportant: And very importantly, we'll ensure that you …
masterclass.oneSizeTitle: Do NOT Use A 'One Size Fits All' Approach
masterclass.oneSize1: When you've met one neurodivergent person … you've met one neurodivergent person! Every ND client has their own unique set of problems, strengths, and needs – so we need to tailor what we do to suit each unique individual.
masterclass.oneSize2: That's why you'll learn to use multi-purpose tools, and highly flexible strategies, easily modifiable to suit different issues. For example, you'll learn how to quickly analyse the function of literally any problematic behaviour – from 'meltdowns' and 'doom-scrolling' to self-harming and substance abuse – and use this information to target the behaviour precisely and effectively.
masterclass.youWillLearnTitle: You Will Learn How To Help Your Clients …
masterclass.youWillLearn3: Develop flexible attention skills: for sustaining focus or shifting focus, as needed
masterclass.youWillLearn8: Improve interoceptive awareness and ability to notice and name emotions
masterclass.youWillLearn11: Recognise, reduce and recover from ND burnout
masterclass.youWillLearn13: Defuse from rigid rules, harsh self-judgment, and internalised ableism
masterclass.youWillLearn17: Use pacing and resting strategies for fatigue
masterclass.programClosing: So, if you already know ACT basics and you want to upgrade your skills to work efficiently, compassionately and creatively with neurodivergent clients, this training is for you.
masterclass.cpdHours: This workshop is worth 14 specialised OPQ hours
masterclass.whoAttendText: This advanced-level workshop is intended for any practitioner who has already completed basic introductory training in ACT (which needn't have been with Russ). The workshop is open to all health practitioners, including psychologists, social workers, counsellors, therapists, coaches, BCBAs, psychiatrists, mental health nurses, GPs, youth workers, OTs, physios, and dietitians.
masterclass.prereqIntro: This is an advanced level course, which assumes at least a beginners-level knowledge of ACT. Before enrolling, we recommend you do at least one of the following:
masterclass.prereq1: Attended an introductory level 2-day ACT workshop (with any ACT trainer), or
masterclass.prereq2: Complete Russ's 6-week online ACT for Beginners course, or
masterclass.prereq3: Worked your way through an introductory textbook, such as ACT Made Simple or Learning ACT
masterclass.prereqNote: Please Note: we will not cover diagnosis or assessment.
masterclass.diagnosisNote: The workshop does not focus on diagnosis or assessment tools. It focuses purely on practical interventions: tools, techniques, principles and strategies that you can use effectively with any client – whether they have a formal diagnosis or not.

aboutRuss.title: About Russ Harris
aboutRuss.subtitle: Physician, psychotherapist, and internationally recognized trainer in Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT).
aboutRuss.bio1: Russ Harris is a physician, psychotherapist, and internationally recognized trainer in Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT). He is the author of several international bestsellers, including The Happiness Trap, which has been translated into over 30 languages.
aboutRuss.bio2: With more than 20 years of experience, Russ has trained thousands of mental health professionals worldwide. His ability to make ACT accessible and applicable in everyday clinical practice has made him one of the most sought-after ACT trainers in the world.
aboutRuss.bio3: In this exclusive masterclass, he will present a specialized application of ACT for working with neurodivergent individuals (including ADHD, autism, and other neurodevelopmental profiles), using a neuroaffirmative approach that is respectful of differences and focused on practical tools that can be immediately transferred to clinical practice.
aboutRuss.bio4: Russ will share his in-depth knowledge, proven techniques, and concrete strategies to help you adapt ACT with sensitivity and effectiveness, and to sustainably enrich your professional practice.
aboutRuss.keyPoint1Description: Author of The Happiness Trap and numerous other ACT books, translated into over 30 languages.
aboutRuss.keyPoint2Description: Has trained thousands of professionals in more than 30 countries worldwide.
aboutRuss.keyPoint3Description: Recognized as one of the world's leading ACT experts with over 20 years of clinical experience.
aboutRuss.keyPoint4Description: Active clinical practice with a pragmatic, effectiveness-focused approach.
aboutRuss.ctaDescription: Discover ACT applied to neurodiversity with Dr. Russ Harris and transform your professional practice.

contact.title: Contact us
contact.subtitle: Got a question? Don't hesitate to contact us. We'll get back to you as soon as possible.
contact.hours: Monday to Friday, 8 a.m. to 7 p.m.
contact.formSuccessDescription: We will respond as soon as possible.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to the most common questions about the ACT masterclass with Dr. Russ Harris.
faq.otherQuestions: Got other questions? Feel free to contact us.
faq.q1: What is ACT (Acceptance and Commitment Therapy)?
faq.a1: ACT is a mindfulness-based therapeutic approach that helps people accept difficult thoughts and emotions while committing to actions aligned with their values. It combines mindfulness, acceptance, and behavioural change techniques.
faq.a2: Russ Harris is a physician, psychotherapist, and internationally recognized trainer in ACT. He is the author of several bestsellers, including The Happiness Trap, which has been translated into over 30 languages. He has trained thousands of professionals worldwide.
faq.q3: How can I reserve my seat?
faq.a3: You can reserve your seat directly online by selecting a city and a date on the "Cities & Dates" page. The registration process is simple and secure. You will receive a confirmation email.
faq.a4: Yes, you can cancel your registration up to 14 days before the event for a full refund. Cancellations after this date may be subject to a cancellation fee. Please contact us for more information.
faq.q5: Is there a discounted rate for groups?
faq.a5: Yes, we offer a group rate for registrations of three people or more. Please contact us at admin@contextpsy.com to receive a personalized quote and arrange your group registration.
faq.q6: What is the format of the masterclass?
faq.a6: The masterclass takes place over two intensive days, from 9:00 a.m. to 5:30 p.m., with a lunch break. It combines theoretical presentations, practical demonstrations, group exercises, and case studies.
faq.q7: What are the prerequisites for participating?
faq.a7: The masterclass is open to all mental health professionals (psychologists, psychotherapists, physicians, etc.). No specific prerequisites are required, although a basic background in psychotherapy is recommended.
faq.q8: Will I receive a certificate of participation?
faq.a8: Yes, all participants will receive a certificate of participation at the end of the masterclass. This certificate confirms your attendance at the training with Dr. Russ Harris.
faq.q9: What resources are included in the price?
faq.a9: The price includes full access to the two-day masterclass, the training manual in PDF format, access to video recordings for three months, all worksheets and tools, the certificate of participation, and online support.
faq.q10: Can I access the recordings after the event?
faq.a10: Yes, you will have access to the training video recordings for three months after the event. This allows you to review the concepts and techniques at your own pace.
faq.q11: Where do the events take place?
faq.a11: The events take place in multiple cities. Please visit the "Cities & Dates" page to see all available cities and their specific venues. Full addresses are provided for each event.
faq.a12: No, meals are not included in the price. We will provide a list of restaurants near the event venue. Coffee breaks are scheduled throughout the day.
faq.a13: Parking availability varies by venue. Detailed information about parking and public transportation is provided in your registration confirmation and on each event page.
